details.title: TDP MPs continue their protest
details.content:
#Delhi: TDP MPs protest in front of Mahatma Gandhi statue in Parliament over special category status to Andhra Pradesh and implementation of AP re-organizing Act #MonsoonSession pic.twitter.com/5fxr8r0Ul9

— ANI (@ANI) July 23, 2018

Senior Congress leader Gulam Nabi Azad, Anand Sharma, Union Home minister Rajnath Singh and Anand Sharma before paying tribute to Bal Gangadhar Tilak on his birthday anniversary at parliament House. (Photo | EPS/ Shekhar Yadav)
Parliament Monsoon session reconvenes after the heated No-Confidence debate which took place on Friday.
Rajya Sabha adjourned till noon over ruckus in the house following Anand Sharma's comment on Central Investigation agencies.
TDP MP Naramalli Sivaprasad dresses up a Annamayya, a devotee of Lord Balaji to protest over demand of special status for Andhra Pradesh. (Photo | EPS / Shekhar Yadav)

details.title: BJP MP Vinay Sahasrabuddhe submits notice for suspension of business in the Upper House
details.content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP Vinay Sahasrabuddhe gave a notice for suspension of business in Rajya Sabha to take up the issue of flood and other natural calamities due to heavy rain in several parts of the country.

details.title: PM Narendra Modi didn't bother to answer any of our questions: Jayadev Galla
details.content: In an interview with ANI, TDP MP Jayadev Galla said, "we had been moving the no confidence motion for entire second half of budget session, finally the discussion took place but PM didn't bother to answer any of our question,we heard same statements,so nothing has changed for us, no option rather than to protest".

details.title: Prakash Javadekar mocks Rahul Gandhi amidst uproar in Lok Sabha
details.content: HRD Minister Prakash Javadekar takes a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi amidst uproar in the lower house of the Parliament. He said,"everyone can see everything live. Even if someone winks, everyone can seee it".

details.title: Rajasthan police is supporting cow vigilantes: Asaduddin Owaisi
details.content:
Rajasthan police's actions are not a surprise to me, they did the same in Tilu khan murder case. Rajasthan police is supporting cow vigilantes. These Gau Rakshaks and police are in this together: Asaduddin Owaisi on Alwar lynching case pic.twitter.com/j7Dobo4Q6t

— ANI (@ANI) July 23, 2018

The Anti-Trafficking Bill is likely to be discussed in today's session. The bill, Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) was introduced in the monsoon session by Minister of Maneka Gandhi, the Minister for Women and Child Development on July 18.
Biju Janata Dal (BJD) MP Bhartruhari Mahtab, raises the issue of crony capitalism while objecting the dilution of the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (Amendment)Bill,2015.
Finance Minister Piyush Goyal introduces The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (Amendment) Bill, 2018.
K. C. Venugopal, MP from Kerala's Alappuzha district raises the demand to acknowledge the Kerala floods as national calamity.

details.title: Don't politicise human suffering: Ananth Kumar
details.content: Minister for Parliamentary Affairs Ananth Kumar, responding to K C Venugopa's demand said that floods have hit different parts of the country, therefore it is a matter of concern but there is no need politicise the issue of human suffering.

details.title: Don't politicise rapes: Sumitra Mahajan
details.content: Lok Sabha Sumitra Mahajan warns Congress MP Jyotiraditya Madhavrao Scindia and asked him not to politicise rapes when he raised the issues of rising criminalities against women in the country.
Rajya Sabha adjourned till 2 pm.

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned amid lynching debate
details.content: Speaker Sumitra Mahajan adjourned the lower house till 2pm as Alwar MP Karan Singh Yadav raised the issue of the recent Alwar lynching and ongoing cow vigilantism in the country. Yadav reminded the house that this is the fourth such lynching case to take place in his constituency in a year.

details.title: Congress to move counter privilege motion
details.content: Congress to move privilege motion against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Lok Sabha on Rafale issue.(ANI)

details.title: Bihar MP Pappu Yadav raises Muzaffarpur Shelter Home rape issue in Lok Sabha
details.content:
Madhepura (Bihar) MP Pappu Yadav raises Muzaffarpur Shelter Home rape issue in Lok Sabha, demands CBI inquiry. #MonsoonSession pic.twitter.com/HbGKM0iEZS

— ANI (@ANI) July 23, 2018

details.title: What is the Rafale deal conflict?
details.content:
Congress President Rahul Gandhi in his recent Lok Sabha speech during the debate on the No-Confidence Motion against the Modi government, attacked Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for the umpteenth time over the Rafale fighter jet deal with France. In his latest jibe, Rahul accused Sitharaman of “lying” to the nation over the Rafale deal’s ‘secrecy’, while the Defence Minister has outrightly denied the claim.

READ MORE| Rafale deal conflict explained: Here's what Congress and BJP said over the past three years
The Parliament reconvenes

details.title: It is shameful that Rahul Gandhi is doing  VULTURE POLITICS : Union Minister Smriti Irani
details.content:
Rahul Gandhi’s family presided over the worst form of hate in 1984, Bhagalpur & Nellie & many other instances.

It is shameful that he is doing the same through VULTURE POLITICS.

Not a single instance goes by where he doesn't attempt to rupture social bonds for electoral gains. https://t.co/kpX3n1Kcc0

— Smriti Z Irani (@smritiirani) July 23, 2018

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman have misled the Parliament.The statement sent by French Government talks of classified information on security,defence and operational capability;nowhere it refers to price.The price is not covered under the confidential agreement: Anand Sharma, Congress (ANI)

details.title: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal hits out at Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
Stop jumping with joy every time a crime happens, Mr Rahul Gandhi.

The state has already assured strict & prompt action.

You divide the society in every manner possible for electoral gains & then shed crocodile tears.

Enough is Enough. You are a MERCHANT OF HATE. https://t.co/4thsyNL3nx

— Piyush Goyal (@PiyushGoyal) July 23, 2018

Congress leader Anand Sharma today accused the government of misusing central agencies like the CBI and the ED to settle political scores, leading to an atmosphere of "distrust, fear and terror" in the country. (PTI)

Indian Government has sent strong advisories to all the state governments and lynching issue has been taken up very seriously, no leniency in terms of action will be there: MoS Home Kiren Rijiju. pic.twitter.com/09e8iGK47A

— ANI (@ANI) July 23, 2018

details.title: BJP protests in Lok Sabha
details.content:
The lynching of a man in Rajasthan's Alwar district was today raised in the Lok Sabha by a Congress MP, triggering protests from BJP members. Karan Singh Yadav of the Congress raised the issue during Zero Hour and said it was the fourth such incident in the state.

CLICK HERE TO READ FULL REPORT
RJD National Spokesperson Shankar Charan Tripathi has been expelled from the party. Tripathi had criticized Rahul Gandhi for hugging PM Modi in Lok Sabha during No Confidence Motion debate.

There is no proposal to control social media, Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Rajyavardhan Rathore in a written reply informed the Rajya Sabha.
